intro: Phaca triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered phaca, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny environments and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Phaca triflora is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
